DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Partial Thromboplastin Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding the results of INR and aPTT measurement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Partial Thromboplastin Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._System established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests. Under this system, results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used._This is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation. Significant deficiency in factors II, V, VIII, IX, X, XI, XII or anticoagulants will prolong PTT. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary)_Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: International Normalized Ratio Partial Thromboplastin Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: System established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests. Under this system, results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.:This is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation. Significant deficiency in factors II, V, VIII, IX, X, XI, XII or anticoagulants will prolong PTT. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary):Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A system, commonly called the INR, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivity index (ISI) for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combination utilized to perform the test; the ratio of a patient's clotting time to the lab's mean reference value is normalized against the ISI. (from medterms.com and medicine.ucsf.edu)

A measurement of the length of time that it takes for clotting to occur when activating reagents are added to a plasma specimen. The test is partial due to the absence of tissue factor (Factor III) from the reaction mixture.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are pre-study coagulation par
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR, aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, except where a Lupus anticoagulant has been confirmed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR, aPTT) less than or equal to 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, except where a Lupus anticoagulant has been confirmed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is undergoing biopsy, is INR Less than or equal to 1.4 and PT less than or equal to 40 seconds (unless due to lupus anticoagulant)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR, aPTT) less than or equal to 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, except where a Lupus anticoagulant has been confirmed or the patient is on warfarin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is undergoing biopsy, is INR less than or equal to 1.4 and PTT less than or equal to 40 seconds (unless due to lupus anticoagulant)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, within 7 days prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are International Normalization Ratio (INR) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than 1.5 x ULN unless patients are receiving therapeutic anticoagulation which affects these parameters?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study PT/INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study aPTT  less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, is INR or aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for patients not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is INR or aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study INR or aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 7/26/2022: fixed the symbol x in AQT per ticket #CADSR0001349.wz
